item.title: Google may cut pay of staff who work from home
item.description: The tech giant has developed a calculator that lets staff see the effects of remote working.

item.title: Post Office to fight six appeals in IT scandal
item.description: More appeal cases are being heard after hundreds of sub-postmasters were wrongly accused of stealing.

item.title: White House urges action on oil as gasoline prices rise
item.description: The global recovery could falter if major oil-producing nations do not increase supply, says the White House.

item.title: Morrisons to give workers Boxing Day off
item.description: The supermarket chain has given all its 111,000 staff the day off as a reward for their work during the pandemic.

item.title: David Cameron in row over promoting genetics firm Illumina
item.description: Mr Cameron encouraged Matt Hancock to speak at a conference co-hosted by Illumina before it won a government contract.

item.title: Deliveroo orders double as lockdown habits endure
item.description: First results from the newly floated food delivery firm see first-half losses narrow to £104.8m.

item.title: Winchester is now the least affordable UK city to buy a home
item.description: Winchester has leapfrogged Oxford to become the UK’s least affordable city to buy a home, says a survey.

item.title: Working from home job adverts rise
item.description: Recruitment firms say an increasing number of jobseekers now expect flexible working "as the norm".

item.title: Odeon owner AMC to accept payment in Bitcoin
item.description: Cinemagoers will be able to buy tickets and popcorn using the cryptocurrency, says the US chain.

item.title: Hackers steal $600m in major cryptocurrency heist
item.description: Thousands of digital tokens have been stolen by hackers in one of the largest cryptocurrency heists.

item.title: Gower salt marsh lamb receives protected status
item.description: The meat from lambs born and bred on the Gower Peninsula is now protected from copycat rivals.

item.title: China tech giant Xiaomi aims at global smartphone top spot
item.description: The comments come as the Beijing-based firm celebrates the 10th anniversary of its first smartphone.

item.title: Northern Ireland firm Euro Auctions sold for £775m
item.description: The Dromore company, set up in 1998, has grown to have more than 200 staff across 14 countries.

item.title: David Cameron personally promoted Greensill to investors
item.description: BBC Panorama finds Mr Cameron appeared alongside the controversial company's founder at a 2019 event.

item.title: Amazon to pay out over defective third party goods
item.description: The shopping giant will compensate customers who are harmed by defective goods sold in the US.

item.title: No auction showdown in battle to buy asthma firm
item.description: Philip Morris and private equity firm Carlyle have placed bids to buy drugmaker Vectura.

item.title: JetBlue to launch NY-UK flights despite pandemic
item.description: The airline says there is "strong demand" for the route as the global travel industry recovers.

item.title: Paddy Power owner betting shop revenue rebounds
item.description: Gambling giant Flutter says shop revenue jumps as number of gamblers leaps by 40%.

item.title: Second-hand car sales soar amid shortage of new models
item.description: Used car transactions have more than doubled in the last few months, according to the industry body.

item.title: TikTok named as the most downloaded app of 2020
item.description: The Chinese app's popularity comes even after former President Donald Trump tried to ban it in the US.

item.title: Anger at overflowing Covid test drop boxes
item.description: Provider Randox says it is increasing collections but the tests for UK arrivals are branded "pointless".

item.title: Apple defends new photo scanning child protection tech
item.description: The tech giant has insisted that its new technology will not be used to spy on its users.

item.title: Sharing apps are booming but will the kindness continue?
item.description: The pandemic sparked a surge in activity for sharing apps like Olio but has the trend run its course?

item.title: Can technology help authors write a book?
item.description: Writing a novel is notoriously difficult, but technology may give the writer a helping hand.

item.title: The activist entrepreneurs running zero-waste shops
item.description: Environmentally conscious entrepreneurs explain the movement towards zero-waste lifestyles.

item.title: Why artificial intelligence is being used to write adverts
item.description: Advertisers are increasingly using artificial intelligence to come up with their winning slogans.

item.title: Plain sailing: Boating holidays on the rise across the UK
item.description: More people are hiring boats to travel along the UK's canals and rivers amid travel restrictions.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Airbnb boss shares his business advice
item.description: Brian Chesky, co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, shares his business advice for the CEO Secrets series.

item.title: The downfall of Nissan's Carlos Ghosn: An insider's view
item.description: Former Nissan lawyer Ravinder Passi had a ringside seat of the downfall of chairman Carlos Ghosn.

item.title: What is solarpunk and can it help save the planet?
